text: The Harley-Davidson Model 1 was the first motorcycle produced by the American manufacturer Harley-Davidson. The purchase price was 200 US dollars; 38 copies were made.Tod Rafferty: Harley-Davidson. 1. Auflage. Motorbuch Verlag, Stuttgart 1997, , S. 10. == History == William S. Harley and Arthur Davidson developed the first prototype of a motorcycle in 1903. The engine was designed according to the system De Dion-Bouton, had a displacement of 167 cc and made about 2 ps (1.5 kw). Since Harley and Davidson were dissatisfied with the performance, in 1904, cubic capacity was increased to 405 cm³ at one of bore 76 mm and one stroke 89 mm. From this pre-production model came two copies.Jerry Hatfield: Standard Catalog of American Motorcycles 1898-1981. Krause Publications, 2006, , S. 116. == References == 1 Category:Motorcycles introduced in the 1900s
title: Harley-Davidson Model 1
